fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40304].
  {panel}

I'm working on code to import content from our custom in-house Wiki to Confluence via the API and I'm finding the Confluence REST API documentation to be really inadequate:

Requests and especially responses are not detailed in full, so I keep having to just spit out the response to my requests and divine the object model.  It's really a bummer since you fine folks obviously know all this info.  Why not share?

I'd like to see all possible responses fully documented:
- A happy-path example with all possible options in the request and response.
- All possible errors (e.g. not authorized, duplicate space key, etc.), again all possible options in the request and response.

Also, FYI, my employer plans to open source my work as the beginnings of a C# Confluence REST API client, a la Octokit.NET, in case anyone finds this work useful.
fields.summary: Confluence REST API Documentation is Inadequate
Provide ability to email Confluence page as the email body content.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40289].
  {panel}

h2. Summary

The WebDAV Launcher Office Connector is not signed correctly and so does not install or run in Firefox 43.0 or greater. This is [a recent change in Mozilla policy|https://wiki.mozilla.org/Addons/Extension_Signing] for extension signing.

h2. Environment
* Firefox 43.0 or higher
* WebDAV Launcher 1.0.8.1-signed
* Windows, Linux or Mac

h2. Steps to Reproduce
In Firefox
# Go to Help > About Firefox
# Make sure Firefox is version 43.0 or higher
# Uninstall the WebDav Launcher

In Confluence
# Go to a page with a Word document as an attachment
# Click on the Word document
# Click ... > Edit in Office
# Click Ok for the Download box
# Click Allow

See error

h2. Expected Results
The document should load in Word

h2. Actual Results
The Firefox add-on is not added. If it is already added, it will not work. The Add-on shows
{noformat}
The add-on downloaded from this site could not be installed because it appears to be corrupt.
{noformat}
The WebDAV launcher is disabled with the message
{noformat}
WebDAV Launcher could not be verified for use in Firefox and has been disabled.
{noformat}
 
h2. Notes
This is [a change in Firefox with Add-ons that are not signed correctly|https://wiki.mozilla.org/Addons/Extension_Signing].

h2.Workaround 1
# Download the plugin directly from mozilla (using Chrome so it doesn't auto install)  https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/downloads/file/259818/webdav_launcher-1.0.8-fx.xpi
# Go to {{about:addons}}, then Cog Menu > Install Add-On from file and select the {{.xpi}} file
# Click Install on the pop-up box, then Restart

h2.Workaround 2
# Go the location bar and enter {{about:config}}
# Click _I'll be careful, I promise!_
# In the new Search field at the top enter {{xpinstall.signatures.required}}
# Double click the entry to make it *false*

You can also put this entry in {{user.js}} in the firefox profile directory
{code:title=user.js|language=javascript}
user_pref("xpinstall.signatures.required", false);
{code}

The plugin will now work.
fields.summary: WebDAV Launcher Office Connector is broken in Firefox 43.0

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40277].
  {panel}

h3.Summary
* Requesting to add into the [task report macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/task-report-macro-590260009.html] a summary, displayed in [charts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/displaying-search-results-as-a-chart-185729486.html] and/or [statistics|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/adding-the-issue-statistics-gadget-185729546.html] in a similar or same way Jira Issues have to create a weekly report of how many tasks were done during the week by each team member and how many are still open.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Insert into a space the *task report macro* to track the tasks.

h3. Expected Results
* Show a chart and/or a statistic summary for a specific and/or overall tasks.

h3. Actual Results
* No chart and/or statistic summary.
* The current report just give the list of task for each project member and doesn't give a summary in numbers.
fields.summary: Task Report Macro Summary - Chart and/or Statistic numbers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40275].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
* This specific timezone has a different DST from other similar timezones. Users have to change it manually everytime it switches. It would help if the mentioned timezone could be found in the UI, as it is unique.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Log into Confluence, go to user *Profile* > *Settings* click on *edit* and select time zone.

h3. Expected results
* Paraguay/Asuncion Timezone in the UI.

h3. Actual results
* Paraguay/Asuncion Timezone missing from the UI.

h3. Workaround
* You can configure it by setting the timezone in the JAVA environment, your JVM for Confluence, see [Setting the timezone for the JAVA environment|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Setting+the+timezone+for+the+JAVA+environment], a list for the [Timezone|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones] then you can configure your [Confluence System Properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-system-properties-168002854.html] for your desired timezone, it will be set as *default* when Confluence starts up (users can still choose their own timezone through the UI).
fields.summary: Missing Paraguay/Asuncion Timezone from the UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40272].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Customizing the *Link* Color via the [Customising Colour Schemes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/customising-colour-schemes-135906.html] panel does not affect all links in the sidebar within Spaces.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* *Confluence Administration* > *General Configuration* > *Colour Scheme* > *Edit*
* Change *Links* to a custom color (#E90029)
* *Save*

h3. Expected Results
All links should be turned red on all pages-- Dashboard, Spaces, Pages

h3. Actual Results
Not all links' colors are changed. If you go to any Space, the *page tree* will not be affected
!Screen Shot 2015-12-17 at 12.03.03 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* Tested, and does not affect versions 5.8.18, 5.8.16
* Version 6.0.0-OD-2016.02: Only affect unvisited links. Visited links worked fine.

h3. Workaround (For Server Version)
Adding the below CSS to fix the issue:
* *Confluence Administration* > *General Configuration* > *Style Sheet* > *Edit*
* {code}
.acs-side-bar a,
.acs-side-bar td a
{ color: #E90029; }
{code}
* *Save*

No workaround for Cloud version at the moment
fields.summary: Customizing Link Color via Customizing Color Schemes does not affect Sidebar links in Spaces

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Confluence is not able to recognize if a user is present in more than one directory.  It is also not possible to delete users who have created content.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Confluence should be able to recognize if a user is present in more than one directory and allow deletion of the user who created content in this case.  In essence migrating the user to a new directory.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40249].
  {panel}

Retrieving inline comment replies (/rest/inlinecomments/1.0/comments/<comment_id>/replies) is an operation that requires two database connections.

If a page has a sizable number of resolved inline comments (20 in my test), that each have a number of comments (5 in my test), and the user opens up the "resolved comments" display for the page, the browser will launch off an individual request for every comment.  This flood of requests can cause DBCP exhaustion due to requiring 2 DB connections.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a new page
# Add 20 inline comments to it
# Add 5 replies to each inline comment
# Resolve all inline comments
# Refresh the page to ensure browser doesn't have anything stored locally
# Click the "Resolved comments" menu item from the "..."

*Expected behaviour*
- A single request is launched to retrieve the information
- The information is displayed

*Actual behaviour*
- Partial information is displayed (and may even look accurate, but it's incomplete)
- Confluence locks up until the DBCP requests time out
fields.summary: Listing resolved inline comments does not batch the request, leading to DBCP exhaustion

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40227].
  {panel}

*Current Behavior*
Currently, it is not possible to add additional/extra colum in Jira Issue filter table limits in Confluence for note purposes such as adding relevant information to the issues or annotate project status.

*Requested Behavior*
Able to add additional columns to the table and add other Confluence content to each row (e.g. a status lozenge, a notes field). The content added to each row should remain synced with the JIRA issue for that row, so if the issues that match the issue filter changes, the custom content stays associated with the specific JIRA issue.
fields.summary: Allow Confluence user to add extra column in JIRA table in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40225].
  {panel}

Currently, you can enable the User Access Logging to see what pages users accessed, however, if a user tried to search a page in the "Search" box, the filter that he wrote won't appear in Confluence logs.
{panel}
*Steps to reproduce*
# Enable [User Access Logging|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+Enable+User+Access+Logging].
# Search a page in the *Search* box located in the top navigation bar.
#  Access Confluence's logs.
{panel}
*Expected Behaviour:*
The search filter will appear in Confluence logs.

*Current Behaviour:*
The logs just show that the user access the {{locahost:8090/dosearchsite.action}}.


It would be interesting for some customers, to see what kind of content their users are searching through the application.
fields.summary: Ability to see search queries in Confluence logs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40217].
  {panel}

Please add an option to list only new content in the Recently Updated macro results (or more generally, an option to specify a list of update types: created, changed, etc.).

I need to review newly-added pages to ensure that they are being given good homes, to help keep the organization of our online content from degrading over time.

(I understand that changing the content of a page could change where in the tree it belongs; but the vast majority of changes don't have that effect.  New pages being added in inappropriate locations is a much more frequent problem.  Therefore, the "changed" notices in Recently Updated are mostly noise (for this purpose, anyway).)

Thanks much.
fields.summary: Add new-content-only option to Recently Updated macro.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40181].
  {panel}

Perhaps I am not looking in the right place, or perhaps this doesn't exist natively in Confluence? It does in JIRA however. Here is basically want I am trying to accomplish, 

Take a CSV file, and create blank pages in Confluence based on it. Example would be:

PagePath, Title of Page, Page Body
Company>Company Rules, Chewing Gum, We do not allow gum on the premises
Company>Company Rules, Casual Friday, Wear what you like on Fridays! 

Something to this effect, just plan text for the body of the page. Is this possible in Confluence? I know you can do something like this for JIRA and have it create new issues and set reporters and the like.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40177].
  {panel}

When a page with a data: image is rendered by the word document exporter the data: is analyzed in N^2 time.

Steps to reproduce:
- Create a new page
- Add a "roadmap" macro, default configuration
- Save the page
- Export the page as a doc file

Expected behaviour:
- The page is exported quickly

Actual behaviour:
- The page takes upwards of 45 seconds to render, in a purely CPU bound operation.  If a user attempts to reload the page, then now you've got two problems.

Note that this isn't an issue with the roadmap macro, that's just an easy way to create a data: image.
fields.summary: Exporting a page which contains a data: image to a word document runs in N^2 time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40167].
  {panel}

According to this documentation, Space admin should be able to configure the restricted page permissions in the Confluence, but unable to do so in the latest version of Confluence.:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/permissions-and-restrictions-724765432.html

{quote}
Page restrictions

Page restrictions work a little differently to global and space permissions. Pages are open to viewing or editing by default, but you can restrict either viewing or editing to certain users or groups if you need to.

Don't forget, every page in Confluence lives within a space, and space permissions allow the space admin to revoke permission to view content for the whole space. Even the ability to apply restrictions to pages is controlled by the 'restrict pages' space permission.
{quote}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a space that has a group able to administer it (in Confluence Cloud this defaults to "administrators").
# Create a two users, Alice and Brianna, add both to the administrators group.
# Log in as Alice, create a page in the space.
# Add a restriction to the page so only Alice can edit or view it.
# Log in as Brianna, visit the Restricted Pages section in Space Admin.

h3. Expected results
Brianna can modify the page permissions because she's an administrator.

h3. Actual results
Brianna can _remove_ the "Only Alice can view/edit this page" permissions, but nothing else. She can't add herself or anyone else, which isn't helpful if the page needs to remain restricted but additional individuals or groups need access to it. Trying to view the Page Information page or the page itself gives a "No permission" message with a button to request access. 
 !Screen Shot 2016-04-27 at 3.47.41 pm.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Space Admin unable to edit the restricted page permissions
Product Demostration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40165].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

If a fatal exception (ie, OutOfMemoryError) occurs during the processing of an attachment (such as a large/corrupt PDF or DOCX), Confluence will not record the failure.  When it restarts, it will re-try the indexing.  This leads to a loop of failure, and the application becomes unusable.

h3. Expected Result

Application fails catastrophically only once.  The underlying failure can be investigated and fixed, but the application does not enter a loop of catastrophic failures as it tries to index an invalid file.

h3. Actual Result

Applications enteres a loop of failures where it will become unavailable until Support (or other system administrator) removes the offending file.

h3. Workaround

Identify the file being indexed, and remove it.
fields.summary: Indexing attachments does not remember that an operation has been attempted

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40156].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There are number of reasons mail queue could stuck with no notifications going out. Admins will not be informed to this unless they opened the [mail queue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/the-mail-queue-151387.html] page in the browser.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow admin to monitor mail queue status over REST API calls

h3. Workaround
Monitor via JMX as per https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/live-monitoring-using-the-jmx-interface-150274182.html
fields.summary: REST API Call to query mail queue status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40154].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
A page with the "Content by label" macro, combined with an Excerpt Display of "Rich content", will render itself leading to a stack overflow.

*This causes:*
* high CPU usage with more than 10MB of log every second.
* Confluence becomes unresponsive until the overflow finishes.
* Going to the page can also return an Error page when the page is displayed.
* The page may render with infinite traces of itself.
* In Cloud the page will automatically try to refresh every 2 minutes if window is left open and will trigger the problem again.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.0 or 5.9
* Content by Label macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Add a "Content by label" macro, configured as:
#* Label: "testing"
#* Excerpt Display: "rich content"
# Save the page
# Add a label to the page: "testing"
# Refresh the page (May require 2 or 3 refreshes for the label to be updated)

h3. Expected Results
Page renders quickly and no error are shown in the logs.

h3. Actual Results
Log shows many errors:

h3. Notes
Wasn't happening in Confluence v5.7 and v5.8.10 because the macro didn't have the 'Rich Content' excerpt.
This is the Macro setting:
!rich_content_setting.jpeg|thumbnail! 



h3.Workaround
User a different 'Excerpt Display' option in the macro.

To open the page directly in edit mode:
# get the contentid from the database (Cloud customers please contact Cloud Support)
{noformat}
select *  from content where title like 'Title of the page' and content_status = 'current' and spaceid > 0;
{noformat}

I think if every selectable character in a cell is selected and deleted, that a natural expectation would be that the cell is then completely empty.

It's not very easy to tell what a user has changed on a page containing the Roadmap macro -- it would be great to be able to see recent changes, or compare page versions.

*Page Comparison*
Currently doing a page comparison, all we see is a bunch of url-encoded data, which is not very legible. 
* Simply adding linefeeds between the various rows within the following xml would help, so we can at least see what entity has changed {code}<ac:parameter ac:name="source"> ... {code}

*Changelog*

** <Date>: <Bar 1> modified by <Username>
** <Date>: <Bar 4> added <Username>

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40137].
  {panel}

We just upgraded to Confluence 5.9.1 to get rid of an indexing bug. Now we have another problem and I'm not sure it's related to the upgrade because it's not consistent, so here goes.

We use Confluence for our manuals and are trying to single source, so we want to keep all the images for a manual/product in one place to make they easy to upgrade and use multiple places. It's always been easy just to paste them into a page that we call an image gallery. When we use them, the remain attached to that page but appear   in the manual wherever placed. But the manual itself doesn't have attachments.

After upgrade one of our team noticed that when the copies and pastes, the manual page now has an attachment. Bad.  We can still insert with no attachment but copy/paste is so much easier and faster, and our people like fast and easy.

I did a test in a test paste and the image copy/paste worked just like it used to: No attachment. But back in the space he was working in, my test showed that the attachments were showing up on the manual page.  

So what is going on? Do you have any idea? Why is this feature acting differently in two different spaces and which way is it supposed to work now.  And can we get back our fast and easy method. Our team and other contributors like it as it was.

Thank you for any help with this problem. Confluence is very important to our business. We need to understand what is happening.
fields.summary: Image attachment problem after upgrade

h3. Summary
There is a CPU spike that hangs when using the Attachments macro. This can be consistently replicated when there are 200+ attachments in a Confluence page. The issues seems to be the number of attachments since testing with 1 large file (e.g. 1 GB) rather than 200 medium-sized files does not cause the same issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 200+ test attachments. The following Linux script can be used to create 200 txt files from an exisitng Confluence log file {code} for f in {0..200}
do
    cat atlassian-confluence.log > "$f.txt"
done	{code}
# Log in to Confluence
# Create a test space and test page
# Drag and drop the 200 test files to the page
# Keep an eye on the CPU usage. The CPU should be stable at this point
# Edit the Confluence page and add the Attachments macro
# Save the page
# Notice the CPU will spike and hang
# Disable the 'Confluence Attachments Plugin' and notce the CPU goes down almost instantly

h3. Expected Results
The CPU does not hang for long periods of time.

Hi Atlassian,

I have been using the Content Report Table quite a bit lately and find this tool essential for linking to key documents that are usually scattered all over the system into one place.

I was hoping that you could consider including the following features which would make a big difference to the macro:

-	Option to display the space name
-	Option to display the parent name
-	Option to show the label name
-	Option to display the document version
-	Option to show workflow status if the document has a Comala Workflow cycle applied.
-	Have the ability to arrange the order of the fields

I know that we have the page property and page property report but unfortunately to go through hundreds of different documents including various types of properties can be time consuming especially if we want to point several different reports to that particular document.

Many thanks

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40080].
  {panel}

We are using the Confluence Jira Macro to inform our Project Leaders about the status of their issues in the actual sprint. Having done this, we had one idea about more effective working with the resulting table and two ideas of more detailed information.
# 1.  As you can see on image "conjiramac1.png" we would like be able to sort the columns of the displayed report. You could do this either on the ready report OR you could do this in the "Columns to display" by dragging and dropping the columns to the place where they should be (see image "conjiramac2.png"). I think, the easiest way would be to enable drag and drop in the "Columns to display"-Field. If you want to change the order today, you have to delete the choosen fields and have to put them in the order manually.
# 2. We are missing a time stamp for the "Updated"-Field (see image "conjiramac1.png")
# 3. We would like to see the Sprint Start- and End-Date.
fields.summary: Missing functionality when using the "Confluence Jira Macro"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40073].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Background:
I have a large wiki and have sub-pages that often have the same name.
To distinguish them, I've been namespacing them by appending the top-level category they fall under.
Example: "Languages (Programming)"
Problem:
When I then search for the top-level category page, most of the results are for those sub-pages that also have the category-name in their title, and/or have the word "program" show up a bunch in the body.
Example: I search for "Programming" to get the top-level "Programming" page, and instead I get a bunch of the sub-pages as results, like "Languages (Programming)".

h3. Suggested Solution
Proposed solution:
Prioritize pages for which the title of that page is an exact match for the search query.
Prioritize pages for which the words in the query make up the largest % of the words in those pages' titles.

h3. Note:
I understand that CONF-9261 says that it does something along the lines of what I'm recommending. ("Improve search by promoting exact matches")
I'm asking for a refinement of the way it works.
fields.summary: Refine search by title

Originally reported as [MEGA-2608|https://sdog.jira-dev.com/browse/MEGA-2608]. The Lasso Plugin running on CAC makes a call to {{UserAccessor.addUser(username, password, email, fullname, groups)}} (implementation [here|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONF/repos/confluence/browse/confluence-core/confluence-bucket/src/main/java/bucket/user/DefaultUserAccessor.java#63]), which essentially does two operations: the creation of the user (via the other {{addUser()}}) and membership addition to the groups (via {{addMembership()}}). The user returned from the creation of the user, however, is returning {{null}}, which is illegal.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40033].
  {panel}

It would be good to backport the fix for CONF-36503 so that BTF customers don't have to wait until Confluence 6.

NB: This version of the fix _does not_ include the upgrade task to automatically remove any current space watchers that should no longer exist. However, if you remove anyone from a space as of 5.9.2, _all_ space watchers for that space are double checked, and removed if necessary. 
So, if you have any space watchers that you'd like to remove from a particular space, you can re-add one of those users to the space and then remove them again. That will check and remove any watchers for that space that should no longer be watchers.

All space watchers that should no longer exist will be removed as part of the upgrade task that will run in Confluence 6.
fields.summary: Backport fix for space watcher behaviour to 5.9.2
